feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
feed.subtitle: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Revolutionizing Technical Specification Document Creation With AI Assisted ERP Tool
entry.content:
Use of CEREBRO CODE ASSIT in Technical Specification Document (TSD)

What is Technical Specification (TS)

Technical specs translate business requirements into concrete technical blueprints for SAP developers. They ensure a clear understanding of the solution logic, components and integration paths.

It serves as a roadmap for the development team, ensuring everyone is on the same page and working towards a common goal. 

Technical Specification Stages

Every TS typically includes the following sections:

  • Input & output Parameter
  • Processing logic
  • Program logic
  • Interfaces and Data flows
  • Tables and DDSC elements
  • Function modules and Enhancements
  • ABAP Artifacts

Challenges in creating TSD using classical approach (without AI assistance)

1. Time-Consuming Documentation

  • Manual writing and formatting take significant time.
  • Repetitive sections (e.g., similar specs for different modules) require duplicate effort.
  • Lack of automation increases the time needed to complete specs.

2. Human Errors and Inconsistencies

  • Typos, version mismatches, and inconsistent terminology are common.
  • Difficult to maintain accuracy across cross-functional teams.
  • Missed fields or incomplete specs can cause development issues later.

3. Lack of Standardization

  • Different authors may follow different styles and formats.
  • Inconsistent use of templates or naming conventions.
  • Makes it harder for developers and testers to interpret the specs clearly.

4. Poor Requirement Mapping

  • Difficulty in linking business requirements (from functional specs) to technical solutions.
  • Manual traceability can lead to gaps or misunderstandings.
  • Changes in requirements often not reflected correctly in the tech spec.

5. Difficulty in Knowledge Reuse

  • No intelligent suggestion system to recommend previous similar solutions or code snippets.
  • Re-inventing the wheel each time, even for similar use cases.

6. Collaboration Issues

  • Inefficient collaboration between consultants, developers, and testers.
  • Comments and feedback are often tracked manually (emails, spread sheets).
  • No centralized smart system to manage versions and approvals.

7. Delayed Impact Analysis

  • Manual assessment of how a change in one module affects other areas.
  • Increases risk of missing downstream effects.

8. Poor Integration with DevOps

  • No intelligent integration between spec documents and development environments.
  • Manual handoffs lead to missed technical details during implementation.

9. Lack of Real-time Validation

  • No support for validating logic, syntax, or dependencies while writing specs.
  • Issues often found later in development or testing stages.

Cerebro Code Assist

AI-assisted ERP alters how we think about SAP development. By automating integration tasks that once took days or even weeks, AI solutions allow developers to perform faster, smarter, and more reliable integrations.

Cerebro SASA represents one such solution that demonstrates the power of AI in ERP development by helping organizations save time, minimize manual effort, and improve consistency and uniformity between multiple integration projects.

As AI is growing faster then ever, its role in SAP ERP Solutions will only become more vital, making it an essential part of the future of enterprise software development.

TSD Generation using Cerebro SAP Code Assist Driven

Step 1 Translating FS into TS using AI

Cerebro reads your approved FS and starts generating a technical draft by interpreting functional logic into technical flow diagrams and pseudo code.

Step 2 Input, Output and solution details.

It suggests structured input, output fields, processing logic, validations, and integration flows, reducing the burden of documentation from scratch.

Step 3 Referencing SAP objects.

Cerebro also identifies and embeds references to real SAP artifacts such as DDC objects, CDs, views, RAP elements, and ABAP modules.

Enhancing Technical clarity

Step 1 Cross checking with developers.

Cerebro enables collaborative reviews by sharing TS drafts with developers and architects for instant feedback.

Step 2 Identifying risks and gaps using dependency tracing.

Cerebro flags missing logic, incompatible structures, or interface mismatches to ensure technical soundness.

Step 3 Finalizing with code snippets.

Once validated, the document can be enhanced with sample ABAP snippets, naming conventions and export ready formatting.

Finally Cerebro accelerates TS documentation, transforming high level business specs into structured technical blueprints.

Overcoming TSD challenges with Cerebro Code Assist

 

1. Automated Drafting of Technical Specs

Cerebro can auto-generate initial drafts of technical specifications based on:

  • Functional specification documents
  • Tables to be used
  • ABAP programs or enhancements needed
  • Interfaces involved
  • Data mapping suggestions

2. Template Standardization and Document Formatting

Cerebro can ensure that all technical specs follow a standard template and formatting guideline, reducing manual errors and inconsistencies.

  • Enforces naming conventions
  • Uniform section headers and numbering
  • Highlights missing sections automatically

3. Code Snippet Generation

Cerebro can generate sample ABAP code, user exits, BADI templates, or even CDS views based on the technical requirements described in the document.

For Example:

Given a requirement for a custom report on sales orders, AI can generate a base SELECT statement on VBAK and VBAP tables and structure the report output.

4. Automated Impact Analysis

Cerebro can scan SAP systems to identify objects affected by a change and suggest what needs to be included in the technical spec.

For Example:

“Changing field X in Table Y impacts the Z-report and the P-user exit.” AI can include this impact summary directly in the spec.

5. Review and Error Detection

Cerebro can help validate technical specs by:

  • Detecting inconsistencies between functional and technical documents
  • Flagging missing object references
  • Checking compliance with SAP development standards

 

Conclusion:

The next decade will define humanity’s relationship with artificial intelligence. The focus must shift from mere performance gains to trustworthy, efficient, and aligned intelligence. With careful coordination across technical, ethical, and societal dimensions, AI can become a force for extraordinary progress.

Regards,

NAVNEET DARAK

Senior SAP BW4 HANA Consultant

entry.title: edocument hungary - Validation Warning from NAV /SAP Error EDOCUMENT_HU_INV004
entry.content:
Dear All,

we have the following challenge regards the Transmission of einvoices in HU and the validation at the NAV portal. 

EDOCUMENT_HU_INV004

  • WARN / INCORRECT_SUMMARY_CALCULATION_INVOICE_NET_A
  • WARN / INCORRECT_SUMMARY_CALCULATION_VAT_RATE_NET_
  • WARN / INCORRECT_SUMMARY_DATA_VAT_PERCENTAGE

In SAP itself we only find 99308 HUF for the Line Item Sum (in this example there is only one line item), the invoice total and the product price sum (qty x price). However in NAV 99307HUF are shown as reported for the Line Item Sum? Any ideas how to fix in the Public Cloud DRC. The warning occurs for almost all documents issued to NAV:

Many thanks,

Sebastian

entry.title: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Malaysia Digital certificate and XML version Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Team,

For one of our Public cloud customer we are implementing the Public cloud along with SAP DRC MY E invoice solution. As per below SAP post, SAP has Update 08/08/2024: The IRBM has released two document type versions: 1.0 and 1.1. The validation of digital signatures is supported by version 1.1 only. To have your digital signatures validated, you need to enter the version number 1.1. - Please refer to SAP Help Portal. 

Electronic Invoicing in Malaysia - SAP Community

In SAP Public cloud currently there is no scope to change the XML version from 1.0 to 1.1 but if the version change is not possible from 1.1 to 1.0 version then in DRC side we still need to add the key pair and also the client id and secret id without which authentication is not completed.

For successfully transmission of an invoice to the IRBM portal the authentication is needed to be with status completed other wise we get below error from the BTP below error 

Error occurred during the TRANSMIT step, detailed information: javax.script.ScriptException: java.lang.Exception: java.lang.RuntimeException: Authentication failed. Please check the incomplete authentication settings of TIN C*** in Communication Settings app.@ line 93 in Get CM Config.groovy Error occurred during the PUSH step, detailed information: Connection to Business System S4C_DEMO returned HTTP status code: 500.

If we add any dummy certificate then authentication status is completed above issue is solved but if the certificate is dummy then we get error of "invalid client " so that means in this case without the correct preprod and PRD certificate we cannot complete the authentication to communicate it to the IRBM portal.

But in this case certificate is needed for signing the XML file in version 1.1 and if public cloud is only offering version 1.0 currently then the config on the DRC for the key pair should it be mandatory as even though the certificate for the digital cert is procured then also it is not useful as the version in the XML side is 1.0 only.

Please let us know if understanding is correct.

entry.title: MTD and Advanced Compliance Reporting
entry.content:
We currently do not submit our UK MTD VAT returns using Advanced Compliance Reporting. I wondered if anyone could help me with a few questions before we go live:

1. I've been told there's no way to do a test submission to HMRC. However, I recall when MTD was first rolled out a lot of software providers developed sandbox submission platforms. Does anyone know if there's any way to test the submission?

2. When comparing the S4 submissions to our actual submission I noticed some 'backpostings' into previous quarters. Essentially, something was posted in Q2 with a tax reporting date of Q1 (posting & doc date in Q2). This then backflushed into our Q1 return. When we go live, do return periods lock once submitted and any 'backpostings' get flushed into the next incomplete quarter?

3. Does anyone know of a way to post PVA without manually adjusting the boxes on the VAT Return? I know adjusting the boxes on the return is common place, but I don't like the lack of audit trail in S4.

entry.title: DCPPUSHSERVICE to create DP document from the XML received by SAP DRC via PEPPOL network
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are in the process of setting up the E-invoicing solution for Belgium, which involves configuring the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) connection for our enterprise. This setup will enable us to receive supplier invoices via the PEPPOL network as mandated for B2B transactions.

To clarify the flow: Supplier >>> PEPPOL network >>> SAP DRC >>> SAP ECC

We have reviewed the relevant SAP notes regarding the integration of PEPPOL data into SAP ECC. These notes mention the use of the DCPPUSHSERVICE for sending received data. We seek clarification and support on the correct configuration and any prerequisites or known issues related to setting up this service within the SAP DRC framework.

We are encountering an error related to the DCPPUSHSERVICE in the Belgium e-invoicing project. Specifically, the error states that there is no BAdI implementation found for the interface connector, impacting the processing of incoming Peppol invoices.

The relevant BAdI in question is DCS_INTERFACE_CONNECTOR. We attempted to implement a custom solution using the implementation name ZTXS_DCS_INTF_CONNECTOR, but the issue persists and prevents proper e-invoice processing.

We request support assistance to investigate and resolve the missing or misconfigured BAdI implementation error for this service to ensure compliance and uninterrupted invoice processing in the Belgium DRC setup.

Please advise on the next steps or provide guidance on troubleshooting if we encounter any issues during the setup.

entry.title: "Contact Number of Company Code 5410 is missing" in SAP DRC Malaysia Integration
entry.content:
Hello,

I am currently working on integrating Malaysia into SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) in our SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud demo system. When I try to create an eDocument, I receive the following error:

"Contact number of company code 5410 is missing."

I have already maintained the contact details (phone number and email address) for both the customer and the business partner associated with company code 5410. 

Despite this, the error persists and I am unable to generate the eDocument. Could someone please advise what additional configuration might be missing or where exactly the contact number needs to be maintained for company code 5410?

Thank you in advance!

Best regards
SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

entry.title: How use the Basic Configuration to enable Edoc_cockpit transaction
entry.content:
Hello Community Team,

Please could you help me to understand better how I can reuse the EDOC_COCKPIT transaction for another country without DRC. So far, I know the following

-Enable with the basic configuration for the specific country (This is only manual configuration, for example, enable through SPRO.. Country Code, Document Type,...?)

-Create a program for outgoing message

-Create a program for incoming message

But I do not sure, If I have take into account another important point to implement this possibility. 

Could you please help me understand a little more about what else would need to be done using the basic SAP COCKPIT? I have reviewed many SAP notes, but the information I have found only applies to licensed DRC.

Question:
Is it necessary to implement any notes in addition to performing the basic manual configuration for the country? or should I take the support package into account?

This is to use in ERP.Thank you in advance for your help.

#eDocument #electronic invoicing  #edocument solution

entry.title: Documentation for DDIC tables of the DRC module
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We need to display the contents of our VAT return transactions in DRC and those without DRC (i.e. from the old content FI-GL-GL-F) in a single custom query. This means, for example, that the contents of Fiori F1515 ‘Run Statutory Reports’ – as shown here – must be displayed

The tables from FI-GL-GL-F that are needed to display this are known (FOTTDCLNOT, FOTDECLSTA, etc.), but the only one from DRC appears to be SRF_REP_RUN_DATA. However, there is currently no documentation on how this table is linked to individual transactions. Does anyone have any experience with this and know how we could move forward?
Best regards, Martin

Thanks.

Best Regards,

Chai Fong

entry.title: Interfaces IF_EDOC_SOURCE_EXTENSION & IF_EDOC_SOURCE_PROCESS_EXT for DRC in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Objective:

To manually create eDocument for CLM invoices in eDocument Cockpit as it’s not supported, and Relevant indicator is set to false. Therefore, we want to manipulate the Relevant indicator through standard interfaces; IF_EDOC_SOURCE_EXTENSION and IF_EDOC_SOURCE_PROCESS_EXT. These interfaces are provided by SAP in document- Enabling a Source Type for a Process | SAP Help Portal.

Please note that, testing is done in Customizing Demo but actual Customizing system screenshots are just for reference.

Problem:

1) Source Ext. Active checkbox is not available in SSCUI ID 102190 - Activate Source Type Documents for Company Code (pre-requisite 4).

2) Standard class CL_EDOCUMENT which is also used to generate the XML is not released (pre-requisite 1).

3) The extension classes have been created and all pre-requisites for these interfaces, but they’re not called/triggered (probably bcus of problem 1).

 

Question:

1) Is there a configuration to enable the column “Source Ext. Active”?

2) Since it’s a standard object, does this need to be released as well for the extension to work?

3) At which point will the standard process call below methods, or did we miss something?
    a) IF_EDOC_SOURCE_EXTENSION~IS_RELEVANT

    b) IF_EDOC_SOURCE_PROCESS_EXT~ CHECK_RELEVANCE

 

These are all the 4 pre-requisites that are identified based on the documentation.

NOTE: Pre-requisites 1 and 4 are not met due to standard error.

1) The development objects needed to generate XML are already released except for CL_EDOCUMENT which is the standard object.

CL_EDOCUMENT in both Customizing (Actual & Demo) systems are not released yet:

But for custom extension classes for IF_EDOC_SOURCE_EXTENSION & IF_EDOC_SOURCE_PROCESS_EXT they have been set to release:

NOTE: For testing purpose, we maintained both FI_INVOICE, RE_INVOICE & RE_DOC:

2) The source extension class has been implemented for the interface IF_EDOC_SOURCE_EXTENSION:

3) The source process extension class has implemented for the interface IF_EDOC_SOURCE_PROCESS_EXT.

The edoc_Process is MYINV as it’s part of the Customer Invoice.

4) The combination of company code and source type have been set to Active and you've selected the Active and Source Ext. Active:

Any idea how to solve the problem of the table oveflow in EDOCUMENTHISTORY within Public Cloud?

Sebastian

entry.title: Error creating number group range for range object: EDOC_ESVF (eDocument Spain Verifactu)
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

 

I'm having trouble creating a new number range for the EDOC_ESVF object in SAP Public Cloud. (ID 106923 in Central Business Configuration)

Currently, the default range is 01, which is used by Company A. When I try to create a range for Company B, the option to create cannot be modified. Additionally, when I try the "Copy subobject" option, I get an authorization error.

I created a new role with the corresponding transaction, but even after assigning it, the field still appears as read-only.

Why is SAP not allowing me to create a new range? The documentation explicitly states that I should add as many ranges as the company requires:

(https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a624a4a6d1d8473eb95fb42660127cfe/0c12ba22b3fb4119b0c34475523debe2.html?locale=en-US) 

Any suggestion?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: e-Doc Submission Error from SD Module Due to Missing 'Discharge Date
entry.content:
Dear Community Team,

During the export process, when an order is created in the SD module, the document is transferred to the outgoing e-Document cockpit before being posted and then sent to the Revenue Administration (GIB). Once the GIB process is completed, the document is forwarded to the Ministry of Customs, and the “discharge date” field in the customs declaration file is populated. With the discharge date, the document is posted in SAP. After the relevant test export document is transferred from the SD module to the e-Document cockpit without being posted, the error message below is received when the “Send” button is triggered. Could you please advise on the possible actions we can take regarding this issue?

Thanks for your support.

BR,
Evrim

entry.title: SAP DRC + PEPPOL: Error "XML contains errors and cannot be processed" (EDOCUMENT000)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we have configured SAP DRC for e-invoicing via the PEPPOL network using the SAP implementation guides. In the EDOC Cockpit, the invoices appear as "ready for processing." However, when we submit an invoice for processing, we get the following error in the Interface Log:

"XML contains errors and cannot be processed" Message No. EDOCUMENT000.

Has anyone seen this issue before or has a suspicion what might be causing it? Of course, I am aware that remote diagnosis is difficult, but maybe this is a known issue or someone has already solved it. I found a similar case here in the SAP Community, unfortunately without a solution:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/xml-contains-errors-and-cannot-be-processed/qaq-p/13758855

(We are using an S/4HANA system.)
Thanks in advance for any hints or shared experiences!

entry.title: NFcom modelo 62 - outbound - erro na emissão pelo DRC
entry.content:
Prezados,

preciso de uma ajuda pois aqui no cliente temos um projeto de emissão da nova NFCOM modelo 62 (substituta do modelo 21) de saída (outbound).

Porém, não achamos nenhuma nota da SAP válida para outbound e como seria essa emissão, tanto pelo GRC quanto DRC diz que o modelo 62 não é válido. Verificamos que o link está apontado para o portal NFe e não o portal NFCOM, porém no DRC não achamos nenhuma informação de como direcionar o apontamento para o portal correto.

Alguém ja conseguiu emitir o modelo 62 pelo DRC? poderia compartilhar a experiência?

Algum colega já passou por algo semelhante que possa compartilhar a experiencia e solução?

entry.title: Implementation of a taxable entity across system boundaries (public cloud ↔ private cloud) using DRC
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We have a complex requirement in the context of implementing a taxable entity involving company codes from different SAP system landscapes.

Initial situation:

  • The client XXXX XXXX is on an SAP private cloud system with a taxable entity that includes several company codes.
  • XXXX XXXX is now to be included in this taxable entity. However, it is on an SAP public cloud system as a single company code.

Problem:

  • VAT returns are currently submitted on a monthly basis.
  • A manual workaround using the FOTV app (maintenance of an external value) in the private cloud system would be possible in general, but doesn’t go with the requirements of the client
  • During pre-sales, the client was assured that an automated interface between the public cloud and private cloud would be possible, allowing data to be transferred without manual intervention.

Internal discussion status:

  • It was proposed to use Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) in a hybrid solution involving Lobster (the XXXX XXXX uses Lobster as a middleware on which all interfaces must be mapped – no BTP + CPI).
  • The client has a total of 5 company codes, 4 in the Private Cloud system and 1 in the Public Cloud system.

Specific questions:

  1. DRC licensing:
  • Which licensing models apply to hybrid use of DRC across public and private clouds?
  • Is licensing based on the number of company codes users, or, for example, the number of documents processed (e.g., blocks of 10,000 invoices)?
  1. Technical functionality:
  • Is it fundamentally possible with DRC to automatically merge company codes from different systems (public cloud ↔ private cloud) for taxable entity?
  • Or is a manual step – such as via FOTV – still necessary?
  1. Lobster integration:
  • Is there any experience or recommendations regarding the integration of Lobster as middleware between public cloud, private cloud, and DRC?
  • What requirements must be fulfilled for DRC to process data from the public cloud system?

Additional information:

  • The relevant DRC component for VAT returns in Germany is: FI-LOC-VAT-DE
  • We are aware that there is a separate DRC scenario for processing external data sources for electronic invoicing however, this does not appear to be the case for reporting. We would appreciate your feedback on the technical and licensing possibilities for implementation, as well as any suggestions for potential solutions. Thank you in advance.

Does anyone have any experience with this kind of topic?

I would appreciate any advice.

Thank you. 

@SAPSupport SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Finance SAP Document and Reporting Compliance SAP S/4HANA Finance SAP Tax Classification and Reporting

entry.title: Error eDocument Cockpit
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I hope you are doing very well. Today I have a question regarding an Electronic Invoicing integration that I am developing. I have S4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION, Integration Suite as middleware, and EFACT as the electronic invoicing provider. What happens is that from S4 an XML is generated that will be sent to EFACT, but before sending it I need to transform the XML into the structure they expect and then send it to them in a file. This part is not the issue, I just mention it to give context.

The problem is that when I trigger the process from the eDocument Cockpit, I get these errors. However, if I check in Integration Suite, it shows as completed and I can see the response returned by the electronic provider. Has any of you experts experienced a similar situation?

Regards.
